title: Marco Sturm’s faith in Marat Khusnutdinov gets rewarded with Bruins OT winner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scores overtime winner for Bruins in 4-3 victory over Buffalo Sabres.
Head coach Marco Sturm elevated Khusnutdinov to the first line due to his strong practice performance.
Elias Lindholm's injury prompted Khusnutdinov's shift to center, playing a pivotal role in the Bruins' win.

title: Why Dan Orlovsky believes Drake Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye is pivotal in Patriots’ 6-2 start, completing 75.2% of passes with 15 touchdowns and three interceptions.
Dan Orlovsky argues Maye is NFL MVP frontrunner due to high performance with limited support compared to other candidates.
Drake Maye holds the third-best NFL MVP odds at +500, following Patrick Mahomes and Josh Allen in DraftKings rankings.

title: Brookline farm starts free farmers market as Mass. residents brace for SNAP shutdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Allandale Farm in Brookline is hosting a free farmers market in response to a government shutdown affecting SNAP benefits.
The market will operate at Jamaica Plain's Loring Greenough House, offering free produce on the first three Thursdays in November.
Governor Maura Healey announced a new SNAP resource hub and increased aid as federal food assistance is disrupted.

title: $9,000 in donations stolen from Catholic church in Watertown, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: $9,000 in donations were stolen from St. Patrick's Church in Watertown on Oct. 27 after 5:30 p.m.
The incident was reported the following morning to Watertown police at approximately 8:30 a.m.
Police urge anyone with information to contact Detective Joe Kelland at 617-600-1310; no suspects have been named.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm exits game with lower-body injury
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm suffered a lower-body injury during the Bruins' overtime win against the Sabres, exiting in the second period.
Lindholm, a key player with four goals in 12 games, collided with Jordan Greenway and was helped off the ice.
Coach Marco Sturm did not provide an update post-game, highlighting the potential impact on Boston’s top-line strategy.

title: David Ortiz offers up advice to Mookie Betts amid World Series slump
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mookie Betts is struggling in the World Series, batting .130 with no extra-base hits or RBIs so far.
David Ortiz advises Betts to focus on having fun like in Little League to overcome his hitting slump.
The Dodgers' top-four hitters went 1-for-15 with eight strikeouts in Game 5 against the Blue Jays.

title: Irish firefighter found guilty of raping woman in Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in prison
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Irish firefighter Terence Crosbie found guilty of rape at Boston hotel, sentenced to 7-9 years in state prison.
Crosbie was convicted by a jury in his second trial after a mistrial; served 20 months in jail credited towards sentence.
Evidence included key card records, DNA, and video footage; Crosbie plans to appeal, claiming trial errors.

title: Brockton man allegedly in US illegally sentenced to prison for raping 14-year-old girl
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Erickson Barbosa, a Brockton man from Cape Verde, was sentenced to seven years for raping a 14-year-old girl.
Barbosa pleaded guilty to the repeated rapes in 2020, committed after contacting the victim via Snapchat.
He faces potential deportation after his prison term, as he was in the U.S. illegally, according to prosecutors.

title: ‘Special stuff’: Why Patriots CB Marcus Jones’s October was one to remember
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Marcus Jones signed a three-year contract extension with the New England Patriots this October.
Jones was named AFC Defensive Player of the Month after a strong defensive and special teams performance.
Jones ranks third in the NFL for punt return yards and made a notable 87-yard punt return touchdown.

title: Dartmouth man pleads guilty to 2024 murder of New Bedford woman
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Tyler Baglini pleaded guilty to the 2024 murder of Kerri Fidalgo in New Bedford, receiving a life sentence with parole possible in 25 years.
Court documents reveal Baglini was found with a stained knife and underwent psychiatric evaluation after the murder of Kerri Fidalgo.
Baglini has a history of violence, including assaults and domestic abuse, according to Judge Raffi N. Yessayan.
